Like a really bad porno, without the porn

mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: All of this is way smarter than it needs to be - and it's only the prologue to the main event, which explodes the film into awkwardness but a weird kind of triumph, too.
So a tip of the hat to A Good Old Fashioned Orgy, a frequently very funny movie about planning and executing exactly what the title describes.

Is the world of the film ruled by its high concept, its low comedy, its demographic credibility, or its romantic screwball realism? Ultimately, Orgy's refusal to be any one thing - including good or bad - forms a kind of epochal statement.

Despite the preposterous, kissing-your-sister premise of A Good Old-Fashioned Orgy, a very likable cast and some terrific sketch-style comedy should please (if not deeply satisfy the lustful yearnings of) audiences lured by the film's title.
In essence, this is an indie Adam Sandler comedy, and when its heroes are psyching themselves up for the big event, it's kind of funny. But the orgy doesn't make you laugh - it makes you cringe.
The cast is talented - the chemistry between characters is solid, comedic timing is impeccable and the actors seem to be having fun, which may prove contagious for audience members.
Thanks largely to its cast, however, it's transmuted into an utterly puerile 90 minutes that fit the brain-dead zeitgeist of Labor Day weekend in a snug and mostly pain-free manner.
The jokes are hit-and-miss, but the cast is uniformly game, with Labine stealing the show.
It's all very sweet and lightly comedic. After it's over, you half expect a statement to appear on the screen promising, "No humans were traumatized during the making of this film."
By accident or design, the resolution here is morally ambiguous and vaguely distasteful, which may be the reason I liked it.
A Good Old Fashioned Orgy takes its cues from Sudeikis' character and performance: It's randy, good-natured, moderately amusing, and charming in a glib, facile way.
A Good Old Fashioned Orgy deserves credit for not entirely wimping out.
By the time the sex actually starts, any sense of tension or anticipation is gone. It's the rare orgy that feels like an anticlimax.
At best, the jokey bits are occasionally funny.
Any originality in this new movie is overwhelmed by its lazy eagerness to embrace the new standard for R-rated comedy.
Earns its R but may leave audiences wanting more.
"Bob & Carol & Ted & Alice" meets a considerably tamed Van Wilder for a mediocre romp in the Hamptons.
Completely unappealing people.
You know this supposedly risqué comedy is in trouble when the funniest gag involves a foot cramp during sex.

The sex sequences are revealingly awkward - with their "Don't try this at home" message. But without characters we can invest in, this "Hangover Meets Zack & Miri Make a Porno" is just the "porno," and entirely too tame for that, too.
Avoids funny one-liners like the plague, choosing in their place to deliver only squishy faux-outrageousness that, like Sudeikis's one-note stud, exudes an unwelcome air of self-satisfaction.
Sitting through A Good Old Fashioned Orgy is like being monopolized by the most irritating person at a really boring party.
No one in the movie has a morsel of intelligence. They all seem to be channeling more successful characters in better comedies. This would be touching if it were not so desperate.
The big event plays in the same cartoonish key as the rest of the film.
Chlamydia, gonorrhea and Jason Sudeikis are three reasons to stay well clear of A Good Old Fashioned Orgy, but they're not the only ones.
A Good Old-Fashioned Orgy isn't just not funny, it's totally just not funny.

mc_user_reviews.text: Feels like a cult classic already. It's a weirdly sweet film, way more going on in it than the title (and some reviews) might suggest. More about friendship & growth than boning.

I saw this with a bunch of friends and thought it was going to be a bunch of one liners and SNL kind of jokes, but it was actually very real and very funny. The craziest part was in the end it made it seem like you could actually pull off an orgy and it would be cool with everyone involved. Does that make it some kind of awesome instructional video?

This movie was hilarious and totally caught me by surprise.  While it's clearly in the modern mold of Apatow comedies, it seemed more like a dirty Whit Stillman movie or even a modern version of the Big Chill, swapping an orgy for the funeral.  Overall, my favorite comedy of the year and that's saying something.

This movie is so much sweeter and funnier than I thought it would be.  The title made me think it might be a crazy, dumb comedy but it turned out to be really good, about a group of friends that was totally like my friends (without the group sex, obv).  I've been recommending it to everyone, and it turns out it's already out of theaters!  Looking forward to watching it over and over when it comes out on dvd.
Loved the film, mostly because I loved the cast.  Huge fan of Nick Kroll from The League, and this is his best work yet.  Also, Lucy Punch and Will Fort steal every scene they're in.

Totally loved this movie.  Reminded me of Risky Business or one of those classic 80's sex comedies, but with a surprising amount of heart.  Would have liked a little more Will Forte and his wife, they steal every single scene.  Also, expected a bit more nudity, but it didn't really need it.

LOVED this movie, absolutely loved it.  Most comedies seem to be chick flicks (which suck, save for Bridesmaids) or dude flicks like The Hangover, which I'm tired of.  This was a true co-ed comedy, with great characters and comedy for the guys and girls.  One my favorites this year, been recommending it to everyone.

Yet another B-movie that you'll either laugh with or hate depending on how much you like and have experience with the actors in it.  Jason Sudeikis and Tyler Labine are consistently hilarious to me, so it worked. I was a little surprised that it actually ended with something close to a classic orgy - without giving too much away.  I figured the filmmakers would chicken out and make it completely non-sexual as a result of some stupid plot point, but that's absolutely not the case.  P.S. Why is every TV show and movie set in the Hamptons these days?? NY doling out tax credits out that way or something?

Haven't we had enough of this format already? Four guys and Four girls, who like to party, decide to do something wild and crazy one night. There's the leader and the shy one, and of course the weird one and the funny one. This set-up has been beaten to death! If you've seen Super Bad, The Hangover, Take Me Home Tonight, or any number of copycats, you know exactly what I'm talking about. Granted, the idea here is a little more original than most and the movie does do what it was intended to do, make you laugh. The faces are different, the situation is different, but everything else is exactly the same, there's nothing original here. Jason Sudeikis and Lake Bell do a great job of making us laugh, but again it's just your basic drunken idiots out to do something special, with all the pitfalls, and weird  that happens in-between. It was funny and a great way to kill a couple hours, but I got an extreme sensation of deja vu throughout this film. Overall, A Good Old Fashioned Orgy is good for some cheap laughs, but it's honestly nothing you haven't seen before.
An easy-to-watch erotic/sexual-based comedy with a number of nice jokes. Decent actors. This is a movie to watch once, laugh on some stuff and forget about it.
